str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A plow. From aroo; a plow.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Suitable, fit, useful. From eu and a derivative of tithemi; well placed, i.e. appropriate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
